      • convertMimeMessage

        public ConvertedDocument convertMimeMessage​(javax.mail.Message msg,
                                            File doc)
                                     throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                            IOException
        Convert the MIME Message with or without the File doc. -- live email capture from a mailbox: you have the MimeMessage; there is no File object -- email capture from a filesystem: you retrieved the MimeMessage from a File object
        Parameters:
        msg - javamail Message obj
        doc - converted doc for given message
        Returns:
        doc conversion, likely a parent document with 1 or more child attachments
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - on err
        IOException - on err

      • getMessageID

                           throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Retrieve the Identifier part of a message, that is <id@server> we want the "id" part.
        Parameters:
        message - mail message
        Returns:
        ID for message
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - on err

      • getShorterMessageID

        public static String getShorterMessageID​(String globalId)
        Given a global msg ID, create an ID that should be relatively unique.
        Parameters:
        globalId - the full SMTP/MIME message ID
        Returns:
        a shorter version of the ID cleaned of special chars

      • parseMessage

        public void parseMessage​(javax.mail.Part bodyPart,
                         ConvertedDocument parent,
                         StringBuilder buf,
                         String msgPrefixId)
                  throws IOException
        This is a recursive parser that pulls off attachments into Child content or saves plain text as main message text. Calendar invites are ignored.
        Parameters:
        bodyPart - individual sub-part to append to buffer
        parent - parent doc
        buf - text to append
        msgPrefixId - msgId prefix
        Throws:
        IOException - on error

      • parseCharset

        public static String parseCharset​(String mimespec)
        Parameters:
        mimespec - encoding spec
        Returns:
        charset name

      • getFileExtension

        public static String getFileExtension​(String mimetype)
        Get File Extension for known types. Otherwise MIME part should provide a file name for such things. TODO: possibly switch to MIME4J and Apache James
        Parameters:
        mimetype - just the mime type, w/out charset
        Returns:
        file extension to map to given MIME

      • createSafeFilename

        public static String createSafeFilename​(String text)
        Create a safe filename from arbitrary text. That is no special shell operators $, #, ?, >, <, *, ' ', etc.
        Parameters:
        text - text of a filename
        Returns:
        file name constructed from input text and underscores in place of special chars.
